trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support for <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ImportCatalogPart"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PageCatalogPart"></xref> controls.

<xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPartDesigner> is a multi-purpose designer that provides design-time rendering for <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ImportCatalogPart> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PageCatalogPart> controls, which both inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart> base class.

<xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPartDesigner> serves as a standard control designer, adding only what customization is needed to validate the associated control and apply its design mode state to the design-time rendering.

If you have a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PageCatalogPart> control, you can create a derived designer, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.DeclarativeCatalogPartDesigner>, to provide design-time rendering.

You can safely override any of the members as needed; however, when overriding the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPartDesigner.CreateViewControl%2A> method, be sure to call the base implementation to avoid losing design mode state information.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPartDesigner"></xref> class.
Creates a copy of the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart"></xref> control to render at design time.
This method is overridden to copy zone information to the view control.
A copy of the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart"></xref> control.

Verifies that the control resides in a zone of type <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogZoneBase"></xref>, and then gets the markup that is used to represent the control at design time.
The markup that is used to represent the control at design time, or error markup if the control does not reside in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogZoneBase"></xref>.
Binds the designer to the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart"></xref>-derived control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart"></xref>-derived control associated with the designer.
